description: Kept’s premise is to make job separation a better experience for everyone. We provide businesses and their alumni with modern, comprehensive solutions that are compliant and caring.
problem_statement: COBRA administration exists. Off-boarding doesn’t. Providing supportive, compassionate assistance during job transition is not only the right thing to do, it's safer from a legal and reputational standpoint.

market_opportunity.justification:
Target customer: We serve brokers, employers, and employees. Anyone subject to COBRA (20+ employees) who offers health and wellness benefits in any state is our target. We solve compliance pain points and provide a value add service that makes them better by supporting their departing employees in meaningful ways.
Market size: $7.2B TAM

product_differentiation.justification:
Competitors: Sterling, Wex, Tasc, Basic Pacific. They're doing nothing more than checking off a compliance box. We're making employers look good and employees feel supported.
In-market since: Yes, general availability for about 6 months.

go_to_market_traction.justification:
Traction: We've gone from $13k ARR to $30k ARR in the last 6 months.
Customers: 47 employers, 9 brokers, 1 GA. We do outbound to two main channels with our sales team (employers and brokers) and exec team drives large partnerships like Amwins, Benefitmall, Selerix, etc.
Pricing: All but 4 (grandfathered for 1 year of free COBRA admin and off-boarding for being early adopters). $0.65 PEPM (unless they have 1k+ employees on the platform then $0.50 PEPM). 2% commission on COBRA plans, 1-3% commission on marketplace plans.

ecosystem_signals.justification:
Program source: We've been in contact with the SemperVirens team for over a year as they've watched our development and growth. They proposed the program for us as a precursor to an investment in our seed round.
Referral: Colin Tobias

founder_team_strength.justification:
Co-founders: Topher Reynoso - CEO
https://www.linkedin.com/in/topher-reynoso/
Tech team: Nope, all in-house.
Haak Saxberg - Founding Engineer
Arvind Shrihari - Founding Engineer

strategic_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s thesis around digital transformation and workforce innovation.

red_flags: Getting in front of brokers, getting them to onboard that first client to experience the difference.
We need more decision-makers who want to find innovative partners at companies like Sequoia, Marsh, Aeon, Willis Towers Watson, etc. We need more decision-makers at ben admin platforms as well.

founder_profile.name:
[Topher Reynoso - CEO
https://www.linkedin.com/in/topher-reynoso/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/topher-reynoso/)
highlights: Founder has demonstrated commitment to solving a real market pain, often with personal or domain-driven insight.
Team typically includes technical or domain-specific expertise relevant to their solution.
Backgrounds show a mix of startup, academic, or operator experience that informs their execution approach.

founder_impact_assessment: We heard early on that brokers were disappointed in the amount of effort they have to put in on legacy partners that aren't properly integrating with the employer's existing HRIS and ben admin stack. We made this a high priority early after seeing this. We heard from HR teams that they needed more resources to make exit interviews less awkward and more supportive. We built tools as a response. We are just starting to hear that outplacement is becoming more important and are developing our strategy there to pivot to a more comprehensive job transition solution.

sector_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s macro thesis on workforce transformation, digital enablement, and operational efficiency.

employer_ecosystem_leverage.justification: Could integrate into SV portfolio employer use cases or distribution channels—especially those focused on talent, productivity, or care delivery.

gtm_support_potential.justification: We would like advisors that can move the needle on partnerships with GAs, large brokers, high profile employers, ben admin platforms, and potentially insurers as well. We want to continue to hone our go-to-market strategy and validate our roadmap for growth.

strategic_partner_amplification.justification: Potential partnerships with other SV-backed platforms and vendors targeting the same buyer.

acceleration_readiness.justification: Product and team are early but show clear focus, alignment, and testable GTM hypotheses. Well-positioned for structured SV support.

successes_and_areas_of_investigation.description: Getting in front of brokers, getting them to onboard that first client to experience the difference.
We need more decision-makers who want to find innovative partners at companies like Sequoia, Marsh, Aeon, Willis Towers Watson, etc. We need more decision-makers at ben admin platforms as well.

category_comparison: Kept Inc positions itself against legacy and niche solutions. Its competitive advantage is built on integration, UX, and customer-centric outcomes.

primary_competitors.name: Incumbent Providers
primary_competitors.description: Traditional solutions or services that lack personalization, automation, or modern UX.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company differentiates via digital-first, user-centric, or AI-driven design. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

primary_competitors.name: Point Solutions
primary_competitors.description: Niche vendors addressing one aspect of the problem.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company offers a more integrated or holistic experience. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

category_comparison_expanded.conclusion: Kept Inc is positioned well in its category with a differentiated product. With further traction and partnerships, it could emerge as a category leader.

final_recommendation.rationale: Pending deeper review, financial validation, and external signal confirmation.
